#summary web.php api documentation.

=web.php API Documentation=

This is web.php API documentation.

==Functions==

===post===

post - Route a HTTP POST-request to a controller

====Description====

||mixed *post* ( mixed _$path_ `[`, mixed _$func_ `]` )||

====Parameters====

_path_

  ||A route on which request URL path is compared. If _$func_ is omitted _$path_ acts as a default controller.||

_func_

  ||A function to execute when request URL path is matched to _$path_.||
  
====Return Values====


====Examples====

=====Example #1 Using post function to route to a home page=====

{{{
// Add a POST route using an anonymous function
post('/', function() { echo 'Hello, World!' });

// Add a POST route using a static method
post('/', 'Controller::index');

// Add a POST route using an instance method
post('/', 'Controller->index');
}}}


====Notes====

*Note:* 

====See Also====

  * [get()] - Add a HTTP GET-request route to routes.
  * [put()] - Add a HTTP PUT-request route to routes.
  * [delete()] - Add a HTTP DELETE-request route to routes.
  * [route()] - Add a any request route to routes.
